name: Combat Monsters
description: Where CCG meets proper RPG combat.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or newer Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: DX9.0c compatible graphics card DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: I have been playing this game since its beta stages and have seen how it has grown from a great idea to a great game. Now with the 3.0 update the game is pretty much perfect. The developers listened to feedback from beta testers all the way through and now we have a massive game with some of the deepest strategies you can find in a CCG. I highly recommend this game if you like TCGs and CCGs. I've played a lot over the years and this is one of the best, maybe even THE best.

For starters this is a TCG game, so you can buy packs, just like in Hearth Stone or Magic The Gathering. It's played on a Hex Board, for added strategy. So far its pretty fun. If your idea of of pay2win in Trading Card Games is you can buy random card packs, then yes all TCG are p2w, and this is no different, but it does seem to have a lot cheaper entry fee than any TCG I've played.
SUPER FUN! the game is amazing the cards the spells AWSOME!!! 11/10

It is a very good game, strategic, with a lot of options, depending on the race or races you choose to play with. You can spend only $6 if you want and will receive more than 300 cards to start. See you in the arena !!

love the value for money the style of game play it is a game that is odd and not a copy of another worth having a look at and worth paying a bit for new card or the 3X money multiplyer all in all great game and you can learn a lot from the helpful vets love the game and community

Combat Monsters is a very fun game that is not hard at all to learn to play. The cards and affects are all wel balanced and the playstyles can vary. Any fan of Magic and D&D will find a pleasant mix between the two.   The game is a free game but The Tripler is a must have for $10 there are no other necessary buys which makes this the only CCG that wont end up costing an arm and a leg over the years of playing.  This is a great game for friends because of the multiplayer aspect and trading cards can help optimize decks.
Pretty awesome for a stratedy game
its alright i guess good for single player boredom

This game was great until they made the new update. Now it is a pay to play game. They force you to buy a tripler for $9.99 to make trades with other players. You now have to pay to have the access others have. I asked the company in their message board and was told that they dont want any 'freeloaders' crying about their game, Real nice way to talk to a person, guess if you dont spend money they don't want to hear your opinion. Avoid this game unless you feel like spending big money to play.

I'm hooked! This really is a great strategy game and combines deck building with turn-based game-play. If chess was invented hundreds of years later then this is what it would look like. With so many heroes, monsters, weapons and spells etc, the combinations of decks must be endless. I 'm looking forward to getting more cards and get building. The game needs a few tweaks, but hopefully there will be further updates.  It disappoints me to see people leaving negative comments, particularly about the pricing model. Its a free game for crying out loud and you can play the single game without spending any money at all. Yes, you have to spend a little (or more if you like) to build decks quicker, but I can't see it being anywhere near as expensive some of the other games on here and this looks like its going to entertain me for whole lot longer.  Get involved!
